result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tion C Dallas

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. VICTIM IMPACT STATEMENT

Court is in trial on another matter and unable to hear case at the allotted 8:30 am timeslot. Clerk reached out to parties to request case be moved to 9:30 am start. Email correspondence with parties performed. Attorney Cotton further informs court that he has another matter calendared before Columbia County and is unavailable for shifted timeslot. Case re-scheduled for a Plea/Sentencing hearing on 12/21/2022 at 9:00 am.

Defendant Tion C Dallas in court, in custody.  Attorney Anthony D Cotton in court for Tion C Dallas.  Attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea/Sentencing Hearing. State counsel failed to provide victim notification and further requests an adjournment. Court grants request and adjourns matter to Br 16.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter to Court from defense counsel, filed
Character letter, filed by defense
Received and Filed. Letter to Judge Grayson

Attorney John Binder in court on behalf of Anthony D Cotton, defendant Tion C Dallas not in court, in custody. Amy E Spanczak appeared on behalf of Grant Huebner for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they are still awaiting an offer from the State. Court adjourns matter for an additional Status Conference date, and sets 07/20/2022 deadline for the State to provide an offer to Defense. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Letter with regards to Defendant.

Attorney Anthony D Cotton in court via zoom, defendant Tion C Dallas not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials, but are still awaiting an offer from the State. Court sets next court date for an additional Status Conference date. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Tion C Dallas in court with attorney John Binder for  Anthony D Cotton. Defendant Tion C Dallas in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Brittany Grayson, Br. 16.  mn

Defendant Tion C Dallas in court with attorney John M Binder for Anthony Cotton.  Defendant Tion C Dallas in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an arraignment. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court in receipt of a request for substitution of judge on behalf of the defense. Court granted request. Defense requested a status conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Substitution of Judge, Filed.

Defendant Tion C Dallas in court with Attorney John Binder on behalf of Attorney Anthony D Cotton; they appear by video.  Defendant Tion C Dallas in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Defense requests an arraignment date.  Arraignment scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 022727,
Payable Number: 990916,
Receipt Number: 22RP009534,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Tion C Dallas in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Defendant Tion C Dallas in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tion C Dallas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
ENTRY MADE IN ERROR
ENTRY MADE IN ERROR  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
